claim: The city of Bielefeld is in North Rhine-Westphalia.

supporting.text: Bielefeld is located in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia according to official administrative divisions of Germany.

attacks.text: Bielefeld is located in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia according to official administrative divisions of Germany.
Some conspiracy theories claim that Bielefeld does not exist, which would imply it cannot be in any state.
The Bielefeld conspiracy is widely debunked and considered a satirical or fictional claim with no factual basis.
Historical administrative changes could mean Bielefeld was not always part of North Rhine-Westphalia.
Since the formation of North Rhine-Westphalia in 1946, Bielefeld has consistently been part of it without any changes.

supporting.text: Geographically, Bielefeld falls within the borders of North Rhine-Westphalia as defined by German federal and state maps.

attacks.text: Geographically, Bielefeld falls within the borders of North Rhine-Westphalia as defined by German federal and state maps.
Some conspiracy theories claim Bielefeld does not actually exist, implying it cannot be in North Rhine-Westphalia.
The Bielefeld conspiracy is a satirical joke and not a serious geographical claim, as evidenced by official records and widespread acknowledgment of the city's existence.

supporting.text: North Rhine-Westphalia's government recognizes Bielefeld as one of its cities in official documentation and records.

attacks.text: North Rhine-Westphalia's government recognizes Bielefeld as one of its cities in official documentation and records.
Official documentation can sometimes contain errors or outdated information, which may not reflect the current administrative status of Bielefeld.
Some conspiracy theories claim that Bielefeld does not actually exist, which would imply that official records about it are fabricated.
Government records are regularly audited and updated to ensure accuracy, making significant errors in official documentation highly unlikely.
The Bielefeld conspiracy theory has been widely debunked by credible sources, including government agencies and independent fact-checkers.

supporting.text: Bielefeld is part of the administrative region of Detmold, which is a subdivision of North Rhine-Westphalia.

attacks.text: Bielefeld is part of the administrative region of Detmold, which is a subdivision of North Rhine-Westphalia.
The administrative region of Detmold was dissolved in 1972, making this argument outdated.
Although the administrative region was dissolved, Bielefeld remains geographically and politically within North Rhine-Westphalia.
There is a conspiracy theory that Bielefeld does not actually exist, casting doubt on its location.
The Bielefeld conspiracy is a satirical joke and not a factual argument against its existence or location.
